etymologies: early 19th century. From classical Latin piper pepper + -ine

definitions: A crystalline alkaloid obtained from pepper plants (especially black pepper and white pepper) which is used as an insecticide and to give pungency to brandy; 1-piperoylpiperidine, (OCH₂ O)H₃ C₆ —(CH)₄ —CO—NC₅ H₁₀.
